This is the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the malt that lay in the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the priest all shaven and shorn that married the malt that lay in the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the house that Jack built the priest all shaven and shorn that married the malt that lay in the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the maiden all forlorn that milked the house that Jack built the priest all shaven and shorn that married the malt that lay in the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the rooster that crowed in the morn that woke the maiden all forlorn that milked the house that Jack built the priest all shaven and shorn that married the malt that lay in the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the farmer sowing his corn that kept the rooster that crowed in the morn that woke the maiden all forlorn that milked the house that Jack built the priest all shaven and shorn that married the malt that lay in the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
This is the rat that ate the farmer sowing his corn that kept the rooster that crowed in the morn that woke the maiden all forlorn that milked the house that Jack built the priest all shaven and shorn that married the malt that lay in the cat that killed the cow with the crumpled horn that tossed the man all tattered and torn that kissed the dog that worried the horse and the hound and the horn that belonged to.
